intro: Schoepfia angulata, commonly known as the angular schoepfia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its angular, ribbed stems and palmate leaves with three to five lobes. It produces showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late summer. Schoepfia angulata is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
